member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL
member.summary: TheHTTP_COOKED_URL structure contains a validated, canonical, UTF-16 Unicode-encoded URL request string together with pointers into it and element lengths. This is the string that the HTTP Server API matches against registeredUrlPrefix strings in order to route the request appropriately.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.FullUrlLength
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the pFullUrl member, not including a terminating null character.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.HostLength
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the pHost member.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.AbsPathLength
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the pAbsPath member.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.QueryStringLength
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the pQueryString member.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.pFullUrl
member.summary: Pointer to the scheme element at the beginning of the URL (must be either "http://..." or "https://...").

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.pHost
member.summary: Pointer to the first character in the host element, immediately following the double slashes at the end of the scheme element.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.pAbsPath
member.summary: Pointer to the third forward slash ("/") in the string. In a UrlPrefix string, this is the slash immediately preceding the relativeUri element.

member.name: HTTP_COOKED_URL.pQueryString
member.summary: Pointer to the first question mark (?) in the string, or NULL if there is none.
